From: David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...>
Subject: Cantera workshop at Caltech
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=44728387; y=BJxgUP8Zvn5ODdvWizCimllXsN-X40w7uEDQt6IvfxuS
X-Yahoo-Profile: dggoodwin

I am planning to offer an introductory Cantera workshop at Caltech on 
Thursday, Sept. 22.

This will be a hands-on session in which everyone should come with a 
laptop (Windows, Mac, or linux) with Cantera already installed.  We'll 
go over basic concepts, show how to use Cantera from MATLAB and Python, 
and finally, for those interested, discuss more advanced topics like 
interfacing to Fortran, or using Cantera in C++.  Probably we will 
spend the morning on using Cantera in MATLAB and Python, writing CTI 
files, etc., then break for lunch.  After lunch, those interested in 
"advanced" topics will reconvene to discuss C++, Fortran, or other 
topics depending on the interests of the group.

If you are in the area and want to attend, contact me for more 
information. Space is limited!
